title: Aatrox, an excue to make a new champion with flashy moves
body:
For the sake of things looking cool. Ya know, how RIVEN and Yas look cool and flashy with their moves?

They made Riven 2.0...why? We have champions that do all of those things. Name me one true sustain auto attacking champion? Aatrox was it. What? We can't have one? We can have a billion champs that can one shot enemies, insane damage everywhere, but somehow ONE champ like Aatrox is bad? His win rate was fine, many found him fun, he had definite strengths and weaknesses.

There was no need to take him in this direction. His ult is super cool, I will admit, but the rest...well, he looks like hes going to be a super cheese, annoying champion to play against. Slow, knock up, hook, repeat.

FWIW I'm pretty sure its safe to say that we did talk with quite a few Aatrox mains about the rework. Its always a part of our champ update process because we want to be hype considerate of what players loved about the old champ. However, I do also know there were several strong reasons for updating Aatrox (and all the other champs we do reworks on). We wouldn't rework a champ without those reasons. 

Its cool to hear that you understand what the point of flashy mechanics are, which is to make fun and dynamic game play loops and interactions. I would still encourage you to try him out and see for yourself. If it does turn out that hes simply not as fun as the old Aatrox, definitely share some well thought out notes and feedback on why you think that way. That type of feedback is always highly valued with the design teams because there is something tangible to spring board design conversations. 

Sorry you feel frustrated though :(. Its sad to see someone who is super passionate about a champ not hyped about a rework. I felt the same way about GP, but after playing the new one realized most of my anger was because I didn't want to learn something new. However, after getting used to the new barrel mechanics hes now one of my most beloved champs in the game. I don't mean to unseat your emotions, but to simply provide my own similar experience :). Gl friend.

20 dashes on every new champion plus the ability to 100-0 people isn't being done for the player's enjoyment. It's being done to artificially make LCS look more interesting, since we all know the gameplay has been stale for years.

The issue I have isn't with his kit update. He needed that.

The issue is that he had a unique personality and that's been thrown out the window for a boisterous bruiser type attitude along the lines of Rhaast, Garen, Sion, Darius, etc.

We have a dozen or more champions like that. Meanwhile, the only really calm, stoic warriors we had were Aatrox, Leona, Shen, and Jax to an extent. And none of them pull off the "experienced war leader" the way Aatrox did. Jax is too interested in a challenge, Leona's too "get behind me" and Shen's too detached. Aatrox really did pull off being invested without being emotional about it very well.

Now that's gone.

Honestly, his new lines aren't the problem. The problem is the DELIVERY. If he just SOUNDED the way he did before, it would work, it would come across as "I know how to push your buttons" in the way he insults people. Instead he's just.....not remarkable or memorable. His personality isn't interesting or unique, and Riot HAD to know it was before.

I actually regret that his changed pushed him from GU to VGU now. If they hadn't, perhaps we wouldn't be losing the interesting voice for....this.

ok, like, the stuff about his personailty I can't speak to, but much of his original kit is contained in this rework. The knock up mini-dash, with circle indicator is part of Q, a line skill shot that slows now not only slows, but also mini-roots if executed well, his blood well is now situationally useful on your command rather than either being up when you don't need, or down when you do, or making GA better on him, his sustain playstyle is now consistent rather than just being tied to whether his stats are enough for the toggle to even matter. Like, it's all there, and while I agree there are similarities to how Riven functions, Aatrox looks as if he'll play significantly differently even with those similarities.
Your going to have your hands full for a few weeks mate. Best of luck.

Wait.. people think {{champion:92}} was up for a rework? Like with a straight faced your telling me you think Riot was going to Lower Riv's mobility?  Hell even Disregarding the R and the Heal passive, do you really think any part of this kit was intended to replace riv's?

not entirely, but the very idea or makeup of this aatrox rework was meant for someone else; a long time ago one of the riot development team members said that they would try to rework riven where she wouldn't get so easily countered, or possessing some sorta benefit to at least help riven out, just like how they reworked fiora just cause ya only need to buy thornmail and it would screw her over.

He fills a different niche than Riven.

Riven - mobile bruiser with an aoe execution
Aatrox - heavy fighter with displacements and resurrection

Both might have three part Q but even so they have totally different gameplay. Riven just slashes infront of her in a short range while Aatrox tries to hit sweet spots on enemies.

it is how he was design which is a problem:
Passive: 
               Riven: empowered basic attack after a ability is used to a stack of three
               Aatrox: has a empowered basic attack the deals damage to a % of the targets max health, reducing heal and shielding every thirty 
seconds i believe
Q:
               Riven: a three part ability that allows for movement and small amount off cc
               Aatrox: a three part ability that has a ton of cc, and can synergize extremely well with his other kit, and if i remember correctly can critically strike if within that sweet spot

               Riven: an aoe stun
               Aatrox: an aoe slow and pull
E:
               Riven: a dash that provides a shield for defensive purpose
               Aatrox: two charges for dash with a built-in death's dance
R:
               Riven: a self buffing ability that grants a second ability that does full damage to a max of twenty % of targets missing health
               Aatrox: a self buffing ability that gives a self revival trait

Your telling me that this is supposed to be different from what riven is supposed to be; i literally played Aatrox the same way as Riven during the pbe because i notice how familiar his move-set was to another champion that I play in norms, and was absolutely appalled by this and submitted my statement related to it, this is an absolute copy and paste idea that they had before, which i chewed them out for implementing such method in order to come up with new possible reworks, champions, and items.

I detest the mandate of being un-original with design concept; i aim for the idea of being unique or possessing a style of its own, this does not deem itself as unique or possessing a lot of it's own style.

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

From what I've seen, new Aatrox is more sluggish than Riven who is more nimble. Aatrox' play patterns feel different cause his gameplay revolves around Q sweet spots and setting up opportunities to land them with his W and E.

Riven is more up-tempo while Aatrox requires more calculation. Skirmisher vs Juggernaut.

I don't think Riot should restrict their champion designs by denying certain mechanics from new champions or reworks just because they have been used on another champion.

Yes!! The thing is, they are not allowed to re-use the same design plot at all, they may use a small portion to design something more unique in it’s own way, but they can not copy and paste a entire plot design, place it on to another individual, and then slap the title “original design” on those that weren’t originally it’s owner.

And it’s basically the same thing as to have the same kit on everyone, there is no originality, there is no diversity, it doesn’t make anything special. What’s the point of playing a older variant when a new and up to date variant shows up.

I mean hashishin even deleted his file related to Aatrox of what made him amazing, he sobbed as he was doing that, knowing that aatrox is dead.

I don't get how having two champions with similarities means it would be the same if everyone was similar to each other. We already have an ADC class who rely on one thing: auto attacking. Does this mean they are all the same? No. They have different niches while filling the same role. Same with Aatrox and Riven. They both are combo ability using melee characters who fill a different niche.

"What’s the point of playing a older variant when a new and up to date variant shows up."
Cause some players prefer to play a skirmisher and some want to play a juggernaut?

They are similar yes, but they are not the same. There are fundamental differences in their kits that make them different.

{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}} 

Take a closer look at the marksman again, and you will notice a couple of champs are more unique in their own style; though further work for marksman diversity is required.

But the problem is that aatrox was not supposed to be a combo melee fight, he was meant to be a melee sustaining fighting (i use the term sustain not just to refer a form of healing, but another form of continual offensive style). the things is, you can build riven to either be a skirmisher or a juggernaut, it is all dependent on what you build on her, since she has moderate offensive and defensive power.

This does make them the same, and un-original to one another, already tens of thousands of people are realizing this and openly remarking this as the worst rework ever; the difference is very small when you compare it to one another. And don't state the notion that they are different, just cause one is older vs another that is newer yet following the same template.

If you want to use the argument that Aatrox used to be sustained damage user and isn't that anymore, that's reasonable. But saying he's the same as Riven is not.

Riven's kit doesn't support her being a juggernaut. She lacks sustain and relies on damage mitigation which is a skirmisher attribute.

Sustained damage melee champions are hard to pull off and are rather old design. Aatrox needed an auto range increase on his ultimate to work properly so he wouldn't get kited. I think there's few other dedicated sustained damage melee character in the game (Trynd, Olaf, Jax and Yi) who more or less all have reliable ways to close in on the enemy and stick to them. Aatrox' ability to stick to enemies was bound to his ult which made his usefulness very limited outside his ult.

Maybe Riot deemed there were enough sustained melee characters in the game and wanted to take another look at a champion design with more combo focused gameplay. There was only one combo ability melee champion (Riven) but there were like 5 sustained damage melee champions.

But he fucking is!! Aatrox and riven main who watched or played him on the pbe have already recognized this work for Aatrox as a riven copy cat.

There is a league player named exil who wanted test animation canceling for the new Aatrox rework wondering if the developed combo moves from other riven main can be implicated into him.

His conclusion was that reworked Aatrox is the exact same style (a little clunky but still capable of pulling off riven mains combo moved).

And the thing is, I played riven as a full attack damage assassin, tank and juggernaut build. Your statement bout her being unable to play with a juggernaut build due to her kit is inconclusive.
